alert.note: Alert for Interior Waldo; Kennebec; Southern Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 11:59AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Kennebec and northwestern Waldo Counties through 1230 PM EDT... At 1158 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Belgrade, or 7 miles southwest of Oakland, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Waterville, Fairfield, Oakland, China, Clinton, Belgrade, Manchester, Unity, Palermo, Benton, Albion, Burnham, Freedom, Sidney, Winslow, Mount Vernon, Vassalboro, Readfield, Vienna and Rome. This includes Interstate 95 between mile markers 117 and 141. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
